p: Herein, we report nonstoichiometric Cu 0.6Ni 0.4Co 2O 4 nanowires, which can be regarded as a composite of CuCo 2O 4 and NiCo 2O 4, as an anode material in lithium-ion battery. As we know, such composites, as an anode material in lithium-ion area has not been reported yet. Owing to the relatively low activation energy for electron transfer between Cu 2+/Cu, Ni 2+/Ni 3+ and Co 2+/Co 3+, the electronic conductivity and cycling stability for Cu 0.6Ni 0.4Co 2O 4 nanowires are significantly improved. In the first cycle, discharge and charge capacities are 1120 mAh g −1 and 972 mAh g −1 at 50 mA g −1, respectively. After 50 cycles, the specific capacity of Cu 0.6Ni 0.4Co 2O 4 nanowires remain 880 mAh g −1 and the coulombic efficiency is approximately 100%.
